title: misc/emacs: go-mode `godoc' should use view-mode to present documentation buffer
body:
by **seharris**: 
What steps will reproduce the problem?

  1. In Emacs, run M-x gofmt RET
  2. Type, say, "net".
  3. Observe the newly-created buffer with a name like "*godoc net*".

What is the expected output?

  The godoc buffer should behave more like an interactively-summoned
  help buffer, obeying the view-mode paging commands.

What do you see instead?

  The godoc buffer is presented in Fundamental mode and is modifiable,
  which it should not be.

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?

  6g, though this problem is really about the Emacs go-mode software.

Which operating system are you using?

  Mac OS X 10.8.1

Which version are you using?  (run 'go version')

  go1.0.2 (via MacPorts)

Please provide any additional information below.

  Attached please find a patch to present the documentation buffer
  using view-mode, which feels more natural and polished to me.
Attachments: 1. go-mode.el.patch (576 bytes)
